kou commented on pull request #6002: ARROW-7344: [Packaging][Python] Build manylinux2014 wheels
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6002#discussion_r355701091
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/tasks/python-wheels/azure.linux.yml
 ##########
 @@ -40,7 +40,7 @@ jobs:
         docker-compose -v
         cd arrow
         BUILD_IMAGE=centos-python-{{ wheel_tag }}
-        docker-compose pull $BUILD_IMAGE
+        docker-compose pull $BUILD_IMAGE || true
 
 Review comment:
   We can use the `--ignore-pull-failures` option here: `docker-compose pull --ignore-pull-failures $BUILD_IMAGE`

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6002#discussion_r355701900
 
 

 ##########
 File path: docker-compose.yml
 ##########
 @@ -590,7 +590,26 @@ services:
       UNICODE_WIDTH: ${UNICODE_WIDTH:-16}
     volumes:
       - .:/arrow:delegated
-      - ./python/manylinux2010:/io:delegated
+      - ./python/manylinux201x:/io:delegated
+    command: *manylinux-command
+
+  centos-python-manylinux2014:

+    # https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/INFRA-19499 is resolved
+    image: arrowdev/amd64-centos-7.7-python-manylinux2014:latest

fields.description:
See https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0599/

https://github.com/pypa/manylinux/issues/338 tracks the standard's progress

https://quay.io/organization/pypa now has manylinux2014 wheels on it

I've been experimenting with it and have made https://dl.bintray.com/nealrichardson/pyarrow-dev/pyarrow-0.15.1.dev427+ga309da790.d20191206-cp37-cp37m-linux_x86_64.whl
